page.title: 10The Mosque and The Temple
page.content: The three main regions of this area are{Muslim, Hindu,}and{Christian.} There are approximately 3 Mosques and 2 Temples. The Hindu and Muslim children are expected to put a great many hours into following their faith. A typical set of 12 year old Muslim and Hindu pupils from Hayward School put an average of 9 hours per week into learning at the Mosque or Temple. Children start at the{Mosque}at 5 years of age and attend until they are 15 if they are girls, or for life if they are boys. In the Mosque girls wear cloaks with hoods called{burks.} Boys wear hats called{topees.}Before touching the Koran, any person must have washed hands, face, legs & hair. The{Hindu Temple}is very quiet. Children might listen to a reading from a sacred book. There may be dancing on a special occasion.
